name: Tony's Di Napoli
address: 147 W 43rd St, New York, NY 10036, USA

reviews.text: Iâ€™ve been going here for since I was 16 years old . Itâ€™s just New York nostalgic
Do you want more 5-star Google reviews? Best of all, theyâ€™re free! We can provide as many as you need to help your business reach the top of Google Maps. Contact us on Telegram: @gthisjpeg
Good food! Pleasant experience! The baked ziti in meat sauce was great and I enjoyed a Peach Bellini as well

The italian-american experience that we were looking for. Nice place, huge portions meant to be shared, and prices according to the quality of the food and the environment. We had the fettuccini al fredo and the ravioli Bolognese, crowning the experience with a tiramisu. Solid order for three hungry males. Drinking tap water and some diet cokes we spent 43 USD per person, including tip and tax.

WOW!  A great restaurant at a decent price.  We ordered apps: stuffed mushrooms, prosciutto and burrata.  Both were outstanding and could serve 2 to 3 people each.  For our shared meals we got:  mushroom ravioli with truffle special, chicken parm, rigatoni a la vodka, sausage cavetlle with broccoli rob.  All were incredible.  For desert we ordered chocolate decadence which was insanely large, ny cheese cake.  An incredible meal!

De loin le meilleur rapport qualitÃ©/prix du coin.
TrÃ¨s grand restaurant oÃ¹ le service est impeccable, souriant et agrÃ©able. Les assiettes sont copieuses, prÃ©vues pour 2/3 personnes Ã  des prix tout Ã  fait raisonnables. Aucune fausse note du dÃ©but Ã  la fin du diner, puis le lendemain du dÃ©jeuner (dommage d'avoir trouvÃ© cette adresse qu'en fin de sÃ©jour...) Mention pour les mozza gÃ©nÃ©reuses et les pÃ¢tes Ã  la vodka.

This is my new favorite Italian restaurant in NYC.

The staff is attentive and welcoming.

The food is stellar!
Restaurant cu specific italian excelent de la primire pana la servire,  mÃ¢ncarea foarte bunÄƒ platourile sunt foarte mari recomand cu Ã®ncredere cel mai bun Restaurant italian la New York.
Muy buen lugar,la gente muy buena y la comida viene sÃºper rica,lo Ãºnico malo es que cuando tengo que ver la carta no veo muy bien por la luz
Excelente Servicio y muy buena calidad de comidas y Bebidas

Wow! We had an absolutely delicious lunch here yesterday. Highlights were the chopped antipasto, chicken Parmesan with Vodka sauce (not on the menu, but you can ask for it), and the sausage and meatballs. Also, randomly, this was the best cheesecake weâ€™ve had in the city. We loved every bite and will definitely be back!
A delightful Italian dining experience with a diverse menu and impeccable service. The food was consistently delicious, making it an easy five-star recommendation. #GEMapproved ğŸ’
Amzing atmosphere, great food(fresh mozzarella and Alfredo sauce is some of the best I've ever had), and wonderful service!
The size of the food is huge!

Great dining experience! Went after a show and couldnâ€™t be happier with the food, service and prices (especially for NYC). Our server, Loric, did an outstanding job. He clearly explained how their family style dinner menu works and gave us great recommendations on what to order. He was extremely attentive, filling our waters and pouring our wine as soon as our glasses were empty. The manager, Kazi was his name I believe, came to our table after our meal and spent time chatting with us and made us feel eager to return for another great meal. The food tasted homemade and was excellent. Next time weâ€™re in NYC weâ€™ll definitely go back to Tonyâ€™s!
Loric was our server and he was just amazing. Heâ€™s new but you would never know it. The manager kazi the manager also spent time chatting with us. Lovely evening and experience.

Great place for Italian food
Portions are huge for sharing family style

Ordered Fettucine Alfredo to go. The order was ready for pick-up as ordered. The portion is really huge - it was actually enough for three meals:). The pasta is delicious. Definitely a recommendation.
Me encantÃ³ el servicio, la comida estaba deliciosa y uno de los meseros canta espectacular y da un show maravilloso.
Andres was an amazing waiter.
Worst service ive ever had they even totally forgot a meal! Would never go back!

It was nice to see all the old school Italian decorations. Service was quick. But the food left something to be desired. The sauce was way to sweet for a marinara sauce and had a weird spiciness to it. The linguine was over cooked and was cut in half! There was no way to twirl it on the fork. This was very stereotypical Italian but didn't have good Italian food.

Ubicado muy cerca de Time Square,  cantina de estilo y comida italiana.
Nuestra mesa fuÃ© en el subsuelo ( el tema a resolver la ISONORIZACIÃ“N !!! del lugar es imposible mantener una conversaciÃ³n y poder escucharse y solo eramos 4 mayores y 1 menor !! )
La comida de muy buena calidad,  las salsas muy logradas, las porciones exageradamente grandes !!!
Todos los platos que solicitamos eran para compartir ( sobrÃ³ demasiado, el camarero deberÃ­a de haber asesorado )
Entrada calamari fritos, tiernos y de buen tamaÃ±o y rollos de berenjena rellenos de jamÃ³n y queso con salsa de tomate.
Platos principales,  ravioli di napoli, suprema de pollo acompaÃ±ada con tomate y albahaca fresca.
Bebidas gaseosas y agua mineral.
Es un restaurante para recomendar y volver.
Correcta atenciÃ³n del personal, precios acordes a cantidad y calidad, hay que saber pedir por el tamaÃ±o de los platos.
It was easily one of the most delicious dish I've ever had. Definitely recommend!
The food was good the dessert could be better

Family style dining, we shared 3 plates and a salad among 6 people.
Food was delicious, it took long but the wait was worth it. Wine selection was enjoyed by everyone, as well as some prosecco, and digestive limoncellos.
Waiters were a bit snappy, but we'll just say it was a crowded night in NY ;)
They offer souvenir pictures in a glass picture frame.

This is a truly authentic New York Italian. The food was delicious and service was equally great. I would highly recommend visiting this restaurant. Marco was our waiter and deserves a special mention.
First time here and food was great. Our server/bartender Carlos was amazing and very friendly, also such a hard worker! I would recommend this place to anyone visiting time square

For us a no go! Nothing reflects the Italianâ€™s kitchen! We ordered some meatballs and I couldnâ€™t even eat two forksâ€¦prices are high but fair enough considering NYâ€¦you could definitely find something better in terms of quality! Btw, the restaurant is extremely loud, we couldnâ€™t hear each other and we were seated in front!
Awesome food!

Im so mad I didn't try this place years ago. It was AMAZING ! My coworker and I git the octopus, mussels in white whine & salmon a la vodka - I have ZERO complaints. Our server Kush was great, informative and helped us through the menu seeing that it was our first time. I will be back again and again, thank you Tonys !

Fantastic people and service. Great atmosphere. The food was great. My wife and I both ordered half plates of Veal and Meatballs and Sausage. Weâ€™re glad we didnâ€™t get full plates. So much food, so very tasty. Shout out to Jaime, kitchen staff and Chef.

Every time my boyfriend and I have come here , it has been an excellent experience, no matter who our waiter/ waitress has been. I specifically want to highlight Jamie as a server who was our server the first time we came here. He gave us such an unforgettable experience that my boyfriend was non stop talking about this place. He is so kind and giving and exemplifies everything Tonyâ€™s is. A warm place where you want to bring a loved one.This isnâ€™t the place you take whoever. This place is curated with love and care and it is shown through their staff. Thank you Bridget for being the best bartender, your positive and friendly attitude made us love this place even more! If I could give this place more than 5 stars I would.
Jaime as a server and Bridgette as a bartender is a dream come true. Thank you Tonyâ€™s for being the best restaurant in New York City. ğŸ¥‚ ğŸ»

As a Brit, you grow up watching movies like The Godfather and thats how you see old school Italian American restaurants in New York.

But what the movies didn't show was how good the food was or the amazing atmosphere of these storied institutions, and Tony's is one of them for me.

The food was simple and exemplary, the manager told us the guy that makes the sauce has been doing it for 30 years and it shows.

Beware though, when it says portions feed 2 to 3 people they really mean it!

The floor staff are personable and when I say efficient, I mean they work as a well oiled machine on the dining room floor, it's a symphony of grace and gnocchi, a joy to watch.

Go for the food, stay for the show, and as one famous mobster once said "leave the gun and take the cannoli"

We had a great experience at Tony Di Napoliâ€™s in Manhattan! The food was fantastic, we especially loved the spaghetti and meatballs and the fettuccine, both perfectly cooked and full of flavor.

The service was friendly, fast, and made us feel right at home. The whole atmosphere has that warm, lively New York Italian charm that makes dining there such a pleasure.

Highly recommend Tony Di Napoliâ€™s for anyone looking for delicious, classic Italian food and excellent service in the heart of the city! ğŸğŸ‡®ğŸ‡¹
My favorite place to eat in the City! Food and service is always top notch! Definitely recommend ğŸğŸ˜‹

Food was awesome, and we had the burrata and seafood linguine marinara. Atmosphere was great. Loud but everyone was talking and I could still carry on a conversation. We had Riccardo look after us and his service and advice was excellent.

A melhor refeiÃ§Ã£o que fiz em NY, atendimento Ã³timo, ambiente tranquilo e comida excelente.
Pedimos um Penne a lÃ¡ Vodka e um ossobuco que estava desmanchando. Vale a pena
Love this restaurant.  Food was delicious.  Service was impeccable.  Love the strawberry short cake.

We visited this restaurant for the first time with our family. The food was generally good â€” the fried calamari were delicious, and the seafood in the pasta was fresh and tasty, though the pasta itself was overcooked and the sauce a bit watery and bland.

Unfortunately, the service ruined the overall experience. The evening started with the waiter spilling water on the table and knocking over a glass. Later, he mixed up the drinks, brought the wrong pasta sauce, and when we asked for a different sauce for the calamari, he said they donâ€™t serve anything mayonnaise-based â€” without offering any alternative. He apologized only once, while already walking away from the table.

While we were waiting for the correct pasta, the waiter passed by our table several times but never checked on us, didnâ€™t ask if we needed anything, and didnâ€™t offer to refill our drinks. The most unpleasant moment was when I was served alcoholic beer instead of non-alcoholic. I havenâ€™t been drinking for over a year because Iâ€™m breastfeeding, and when I pointed it out, the waiterâ€™s reaction made me feel as if I was imagining things.

To make matters worse, the bill included two pasta dishes instead of one, and the beer count was incorrect. The food was fine, but the service left a very poor impression. It was what it was â€” we wonâ€™t be coming back.
Italian food done right. Everything was so good so much flavor.
Absolutely love this place. Its a must visit when we come to NYC.  Amazing food with very generous portions! You will not be disappointed.  The best all vodka sauce I've ever had.

â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸ Absolutely Outstanding!
First time visiting NYC and Tonyâ€™s Di Napoli completely blew me away. From the moment we walked in, the staff made us feel right at home â€” friendly, prompt, and professional. The atmosphere is classic New York: lively yet comfortable, with beautiful artwork and an inviting, spotless dining room. We started with the mushrooms appetizer and a fresh salad, both full of flavor, and the veal parm was absolutely incredible â€” tender, rich, and perfectly cooked. Every bite was a reminder of why this place has such a great reputation. Couldnâ€™t be happier with the experience. Already craving the food again â€” Iâ€™ll definitely be back
Omg this place is amazing.  Just a couple doors from Times Square..
Buzzing atmosphere. Amazing food. Fantastic service

This is a family style restaurant, it says each order is good for 2-3 people but itâ€™s actually good for 4 if your have a normal appetite.  The food was very good, so was service.  Thereâ€™s a waiter who loved to sing.  He will sing a Happy Birthday song plus another song to a birthday table. During our dinner there, he sang 6 songs. He is actually pretty good. I think he enjoyed more than the birthday person. ğŸ¤£  itâ€™s definitely worth dining there.

There are locals and there are tourists and even though there are mixture of people, still create such a unified energetic atmosphere!

We went there around 4:00 but it was already full of energy with people drinking and eating and just having fun!

The food was amazing and the portion was very big so I recommend going there with a group of people so that you can try different kind of dish!

You can definitely bring leftovers home but cannot compare eating the freshly made food while enjoying the space!
To my surprise it was not as expensive as I thought if you consider the amount that they are giving you!  But with strings I think it would make the price go up a bit more.

Since the place is very energetic it is very hard to have a decent conversation without having to have to raise the voice level a bit...

Great Italian-American cuisine with very generous portions! The vibe was lively â€” and the service was really nice. Itâ€™s a great spot for big groups, and even without a reservation we were able to walk right in. It is quite loud, but in a fun way that adds to the atmosphere. We really enjoyed the food, though the portions were so big we couldnâ€™t finish. Overall, a very positive experience!

The restaurant has extremely friendly staff and service.  Lots of options on the menu. Beware there servings are huge.  One pasta plate serves about 3 people.  You are able to get half servings which is a bonus.  I had the seafood linguine which had mussels,  shrimp and calamari. All the seafood was coke to perfection.  The chicken Alfredo was also delicious according to my sister I law.  Great location in time square New York.  The restaurant is clean but a little out dated.

During our trip to New York, we had the great fortune to experience maybe one of the best Italian meals I have had in the States. I have been to Italy several times so I have a point of reference. The food was amazing from the salad to the dessert, everything was magnificent. Our server was perfect. She was friendly, made great recommendations and was very attentive to our needs. The decor was very classy. If you are in the Time Square area, you must try Tonyâ€™s Di Napoli, you will not be disappointed.

We had a nice family style dinner with a group of 11. Made a reservation status as quickly downstairs had a really nice old school Italian feel Gabriel was our survey and was very attentive and everyone enjoyed the food we had stuffed mushrooms calamari, veal Parmesan shrimp fettuccine Alfredo. You could see every large table was enjoying themselves with the family style set up.

**Restaurant Review: A Culinary Gem in the Heart of New York**

During my recent visit to the vibrant city of New York, I had the distinct pleasure of dining at a remarkable restaurant that effortlessly combines exquisite cuisine with an enchanting atmosphere. From the moment we stepped inside, we were greeted by an ambiance that radiated warmth and sophistication, setting the stage for an unforgettable dining experience.

The highlight of our visit, without a doubt, was the impeccable service provided by Timmy. His cheerful demeanor and unwavering attentiveness made us feel like valued guests at every moment. Timmy's genuine enthusiasm and dedication to ensuring our comfort were truly remarkable, creating an environment that was both inviting and energizing.

As for the culinary delights we savored, the mixed seafood pasta with white sauce was nothing short of a masterpiece. Each bite was a symphony of flavors, showcasing the freshest ingredients and culinary expertise. We also indulged in the Italian cheesecake, which was, without question, the finest cheesecake we have ever had the pleasure of tasting. Its creamy texture and perfect balance of sweetness left us in awe, making it a memorable conclusion to our meal.

In summary, this restaurant stands out not only for its delectable dishes but also for its exceptional service and welcoming atmosphere. Timmy exemplified what it means to provide outstanding hospitality, ensuring that our dining experience was nothing short of extraordinary. I wholeheartedly recommend this culinary gem to anyone visiting New Yorkâ€”it's an experience that should not be missed!

The food was absolutely amazing! Fresh, flavorful, and served in generous portions. You can tell how much care goes into everything here. I chose to sit at the bar to avoid the line, and the bartenders couldnâ€™t have been more kind and attentive. The whole experience was wonderful, and Iâ€™ll definitely be coming back.

Yes it's a bit of a tourist trap, but where else can you grab a 20 top for 3 hour business lunch quick in the area. Also can complain if you aren't paying and the wine flows freely.

The food came out leisurely in pace with the atmosphere, shrimp, baked clams and calamari perfect as expected. Baked potato, chicken, penne and thick cuts of medium rare steakğŸ‘Œ. The final variety dessert platter just diabetes inducing.

Excellent service, lots of seating and the food was delicious. Great alternative to a famous Italian eatery in New York. Definitely same or better quality of food! Large portions! It's just an all-around wonderfully tasteful experience!! Book in advance! Family styled portions serving 2-3 people pee dish.

We visited this location on Indigenous Peopleâ€™s/Columbus Day at 7pm and it was crowded! Inside was pretty cramped and loud. We ordered a chopped antipasto salad to start and it was your classic Italian chopped salad with garbanzo beans, olives, salami, etc. Wish it had a little more lettuce. For our mains we ordered the veal parmigiana, rigatoni alla vodka and broccoli rabe. The veal was DELICIOUSâ€¦meat was tender, sauce wasnâ€™t too tart and it had cheesy goodness all over. Rigatoni was also good and had mushrooms which broke up the monotony. Broccoli rabe was only okâ€¦some stems were really tough and stringy. We ended with Italian cheesecake and it also was only okâ€¦texture was grainy like small curd cottage cheese and it had a hint of lemon. If you want a lighter cheesecake you might like this. PSA: sodas donâ€™t come with free refills and at the time of posting each soda was $3.50. Finally, itâ€™s worth mentioning that when we sat down, an opera trained server was serenading birthday guests but by the time we were done he stopped which was a bummer because we did have a birthday girl in our party.

I've been coming here for year and have NEVER been disappointed!! The food is AMAZING!! Service and atmosphere are GREAT. I will continue to keep coming back because of this. Food is served Family Style which is also very nice. LOVE THIS PLACE!!! Tony's is my #1 place to go in the city! It's not necessary but making a reservation is a good idea because they are always busy.

Had dinner at Tonyâ€™s Di Napoli , itâ€™s a lively, old-school Italian spot with big portions and a classic NYC vibe. I had a vegetarian pasta and a couple sides. The food was decent, nothing mind-blowing, but comforting and filling. Great for sharing, especially with a group. If youâ€™re vegetarian, there are a few solid options, but itâ€™s definitely more about the overall experience than standout flavors

Good attentive service and a loud, NYC eatery. Decent food, although we thought it could use stronger seasoning. Meats were cooked properly and the pasta was tasty. It can take some time to eat here. Portions are family-style, so be prepared to share. Good place to eat before a Broadway show.

My friends and I came here before a Broadway show and I have to say I was impressed with the food, service and drinks. A very extensive menu. We ordered the baked clams and shrimp scampi as appertizers...we ordered the house salad with salata cheese , chicken parmagian and penne in vodka sauce. We requested mushrooms with the pasta..it was great. Portions are huge..family style..this fed 3 of us and we had left overs..we also ordered the mango tartuffo-excellent!! Service was excellent. Reservations is recommended!! Place was completly full.
